WorkItem.Description:
Every time I start Rawr at the moment it gives the "New Version Released!" message. I have the latest version. I even re-downloaded and installed it the last time just to be sure and it still shows up.
Â 
Not a biggie, just a little weird.
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] New version released all the time

Comments.Message: Did you install it to program files? It wont be able to resave the file right if that's true.

I can confirm this. The 'new' version reported is 4.1.3, which it doesn't appear to exist.

I haven't opened Rawr for a few days but I had 4.1.03 installed which was working properly before.
Mine is not installed in Program Files. So maybe that's the problem.
No, don't install it to Program Files, that won't work right. Put it on your Desktop or in your My Documents folder.
I don't know why you are seeing the alert, I'm not when I run it. the 4.1.3 that it is seeing should have been recognized as 4.1.03 (aka the same thing).
My silverlight-offline version has been doing this since 4.1.3 came out. I will check when I get home today and see if it continues.

Mine does also. The program has a shortcut on the desktop but is in the My Documents folder in another folder called WoW.

Everytime I open it says a new version is available (4.1.3) which should actually be 4.1.03. Don't know if that is the problem or not but is rather annoying to have it tell me a new version is available everytime I open it only to find out there is not anything new at all.
Now in a twist of events, it suggests to download 4.1.03 which is the one running while before it was suggesting 4.1.3 which doesn't exist.
Same here. Got it in a folder on my desktop. It tells me to update to 4.1.03 when i'm already running 4.1.03.
Ya, I can replicate it using the downloaded WPF but if I just run it fro msource code it doesn't do it.
OMFG, seriously? I just looked at the Details tab of Properties on the Rawr.exe you download. It says it's 4.1.2 when it should be 4.1.3. The app even identifies itself correctly inside the program.
I can't fix this for current release but I will be sure to validate it when I make 4.1.04
